summary.para: Retrieves a pointer to an interface on an object that is usable by the calling apartment. This interface must be currently registered in the global interface table.

param.name: dwCookie
param.para: Identifies the interface (and its object), and is retrieved through a call to .

param.name: ppv
param.para: A pointer to the pointer for the requested interface.

returns.para: This method can return the following values.

description.para: One or more parameters are invalid.

remarks.para: After an interface has been registered in the global interface table, an apartment can get a pointer to this interface by calling the GetInterfaceFromGlobal method with the supplied cookie. This pointer to the interface can be used in the calling apartment but not by other apartments in the process.

The application is responsible for coordinating access to the global variable during calls to . That is, the application should ensure that one thread does not call RevokeInterfaceFromGlobal while another thread is calling GetInterfaceFromGlobal with the same cookie. Multiple calls to GetInterfaceFromGlobal for the same cookie are permitted.
The GetInterfaceFromGlobal method calls on the pointer obtained in the ppv parameter. It is the caller's responsibility to call on this pointer.

summary.para: Registers the specified interface on an object residing in one apartment of a process as a global interface, enabling other apartments access to that interface.

param.name: pUnk
param.para: An interface pointer of type riid on the object on which the interface to be registered as global is implemented.

param.name: riid
param.para: The IID of the interface to be registered as global.

param.name: pdwCookie
param.para: An identifier that can be used by another apartment to get access to a pointer to the interface being registered. The value of an invalid cookie is 0.

returns.para: This method can return the following values.

description.para: One or more parameters are invalid.

remarks.para: Called in the apartment in which an object resides to register one of the object's interfaces as a global interface. This method supplies a pointer to a cookie that other apartments can use in a call to the method to get a pointer to that interface.
The interface pointer may be a pointer to an in-process object, or it may be a pointer to a proxy for an object residing in another apartment, in another process, or on another computer.
The apartment that calls this method must remain alive until the corresponding call to .

summary.para: Revokes the registration of an interface in the global interface table.

param.name: dwCookie
param.para: Identifies the interface whose global registration is to be revoked.

returns.para: This method can return the following values.

remarks.para: Call this method when an interface registered in the global interface table object no longer needs to be accessed by other apartments in the same process. This method can be called by any apartment in the process, including apartments other than the one that registered the interface in the global interface table.
